content: HM's government has long since owed the Gurkhas this right. They have fought in every major engagement with distinction and deserve to live in the country they served so well the last 150 or so years. Another interesting read is some of the Victoria Cross citations for the Gurkhas. One of the most impressive is this one: http://tashuk.wordpress.com/2007/06/06/1114/ George MacDonald Fraser's book "Quartered Safe out Here" about his experience in Burma noted that after a charge by a Gurkha unit on a dug-in Japanese position, their Lee-Enfield rifles were all dropped about three yards from the Japanese pits. The Gurkhas had dropped them so they could go into the melee armed only with thier Kurkri knives.* Sullivan013 *"Knife" is somewhat misleading. It's actually a glorified meat cleaver. Wielded by a Gurkha it's one of the world's deadliest weapons.
